subject: Negotiation
title: The 80/20 Rule of Prep
description: A 60-second lesson on The 80/20 Rule of Prep.

hook.text: The best negotiators spend 80% of their time preparing and 20% at the table.

buildup.text: Preparation means researching the other side, defining goals, and planning moves.

discovery.text: Studies show prepared negotiators outperform unprepared ones by 30% on average.

twist.text: Yet most people walk into negotiations with nothing but hope and a gut feeling.

climax.text: A single hour of prep can be worth tens of thousands in better outcomes.

punchline.text: Winging it is not a strategy. It's a donation.

quiz.question: How much time do top negotiators spend preparing vs. negotiating?
